text:
Tomcat should rely on standard xerces and xalan, and NOT include classes from 
either in crimson.jar or jasper.jar; otherwise it becomes very tricky for 
developpers to invoke XML processing capabilities from their servlets, as 
including xalan or xerces in their own WEB-INF lib can create conflicts (same 
class loaded from different jars, leading to a sealing security exception).

I ended up wiping the org.apache.xml files from crimson.jar and jasper.jar, and 
including xalan.jar and xerces.jar in the Tomcat lib. Works fine that way.

jfl
creator: Jean-Francois.Lamy@teximus.com
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
This has been fixed by rearranging the way class loading works.  Now,
Jasper loads its XML parser from a new per-webapp class loader, so that the
shared classloader (initialized from $CATALINA_HOME/lib) does not have an
XML parser visible by default.  Thus, you can successfully use your own parser
loaded from WEB-INF/lib with no conflicts.
